resources.string: The passcode for accessing the administration settings.
Unique Device ID stored in the secure settings and shared amoungst other apps with the permission.
Mock the device ID for testing. Set the empty string to clear the mock.
Mock the firmware version for testing. Set the empty string to clear the mock.
Mock the Sparkpoint version for testing. Set the empty string to clear the mock.
The base server that the device is pointing to.
Engine reports the heart-beat every this interval in seconds.

Choose between Canary and Stable releases. Canary stands for releases that are still pending for testing (beta releases). Stable stands for approved releases that is ready for all devices. When in doubt, make sure the device is pointing to Stable.
Interval in seconds that the recurring update check happens.
The maximum size of cache for storing the download files (in MB).
The start hour of install window. This means the device will only start update after this time. The time is set in 24 hour format. You can only set on the hour right now.
The end hour of install window. This means the device will not be able to update after this time. The time is set in 24 hour format. You can only set on the hour right now.

Turning this on enables the FULL firmware update; Off for the silently incremental firmware update. This will break the heart beat functionality and will leave your device reporting offline so remember to disable this afterwards.

Clicking this button will show a dialog to set the main application on the device. The main application should always be Sparkpoint. Once the chooser dialog opens, please select Sparkpoint and click the Always button.
Show the Internet Speed Test app
Send logs to the server team
Problem while sending logs to the server!
